resources.string:
After dialing an emergency number, allow all incoming calls for a period of time.

- Duration
The default setting 120 Min means all calls will be allowed in the next 120 minutes after dialing an emergency number.

- Check STIR
- When disabled, all calls will be allowed.
- When enabled, calls fail STIR attestation will not be allowed, only "Valid" and "Unverified" calls will be allowed.

- Additional Numbers
Dialing any number in this list will also trigger this feature.

No need to explicitly add numbers like 911 here, because Android includes a built-in emergency number list for each country(e.g.: police, fire, ambulance).

Separate numbers with commas, such as:
  111, 222, 3333

- Reset
Press this button to reset this feature if it was triggered by mistake or during testing.

- Test
Simulate an outgoing call to test if that number is an emergency number.

Priority: Max

{sdcard}
The external storage directory, same as:
/storage/emulated/0

{Download}
Same as:
{sdcard}/Download

{Documents}
Same as:
{sdcard}/Documents

After receiving specific notifications, allow all incoming calls for a set period.

A typical use case:
  When there is a notification like:
  Title: Order Update:
  Body: Your order has been taken by driver â€¦
  The driver may then call you to confirm details.

Permissions required:
1. Battery optimization (unrestricted or optimized)
2. Notification Access

Options:

- App
It will only check notifications from this app.

- Notification Content
This regex will match both the notification title and body.
An example for the above use case:
  order update.*taken by driver.*

- Duration
Calls will be allowed during this period, specified in minutes.

Priority: 10
